summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in New York dated August 20, 2019, following up on a meeting about an updated spreadsheet of identified victims in the Epstein case. The email requests review of victim contact status with FBI victim specialists and follow-up contact attempts for victims not yet contacted since Epstein's death.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting follow-up on victim contact efforts and coordination with FBI victim specialists.

events.title: Meeting on victim contact
events.description: A meeting occurred the day before this email, discussing victim identification and contact efforts.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in jail. The email references the need to contact victims 'since Epstein's death'.

keyFacts: An updated spreadsheet listing all identified victims in the Epstein case existed as of August 20, 2019.
The document indicates an ongoing effort by the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI to contact victims following Epstein's death.
The email requests tracking of which victims had been contacted since Epstein's death and attempts to contact those who had not.
The correspondence shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI victim specialists in the post-Epstein death phase of the investigation.
